column4: i wanted to know how to change the resolution of my screen, the resolutions that i want are not there
which video card ...out of curiosity?   in terminal   lspci | grep -i vga
ok  then open a terminal and type   sudo nvidia-settings
set your resolution there then click  "Save to x configuration file"
then reboot  the system and see if it holds
then open  /etc/X11/xorg.conf and see if the changes took there
neither apt-cache search nor the command is known
did you install the nvidia driver and is it working??
and is a higher resolution availabe in nvidia-settings?
click "X server diso;ay configuration"   higlight the graphic of your monitor and click   "Resolution"
ooooo ok  did you check in #xubuntu or  #xfce channels?
